Package us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame.interfaces

Interface FramePoint3DReadOnly

  • All Superinterfaces:
    FrameTuple3DReadOnly, us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly, ReferenceFrameHolder, us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Tuple3DReadOnly
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FixedFramePoint3DBasics, FramePoint3DBasics
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FramePoint3D
    public interface FramePoint3DReadOnly
extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly, FrameTuple3DReadOnly
    Read-only interface for a 3D point expressed in a given reference frame.

    In addition to representing a Point3DReadOnly, a ReferenceFrame is associated to a FramePoint3DReadOnly. This allows, for instance, to enforce, at runtime, that operations on points occur in the same coordinate system.

    Because a FramePoint3DReadOnly extends Point3DReadOnly, it is compatible with methods only requiring Point3DReadOnly. However, these methods do NOT assert that the operation occur in the proper coordinate system. Use this feature carefully and always prefer using methods requiring FramePoint3DReadOnly.

    • Method Detail

      • distance

        default double distance​(FramePoint3DReadOnly other)
        Calculates and returns the distance between this frame point and other.
        Parameters:
        other - the other frame point used to measure the distance.
        Returns:
        the distance between the two frame points.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if other is not expressed in the same frame as this.

      • distanceSquared

        default double distanceSquared​(FramePoint3DReadOnly other)
        Calculates and returns the square of the distance between this frame point and other.

        This method is usually preferred over distance(FramePoint3DReadOnly) when calculation speed matters and knowledge of the actual distance does not, i.e. when comparing distances between several pairs of frame points.

        Parameters:
        other - the other frame point used to measure the square of the distance.
        Returns:
        the square of the distance between the two frame points.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if other is not expressed in the same frame as this.

      • distanceXY

        default double distanceXY​(FramePoint3DReadOnly other)
        Calculates and returns the distance between this frame point and other in the XY-plane.

        Effectively, this calculates the distance as follows:
        dxy = √((this.x - other.x)2 + (this.y - other.y)2)

        Parameters:
        other - the other frame point used to measure the distance.
        Returns:
        the distance between the two frame points in the XY-plane.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if other is not expressed in the same frame as this.

      • distanceXYSquared

        default double distanceXYSquared​(FramePoint3DReadOnly other)
        Calculates and returns the square of the distance between this frame point and other in the XY-plane.

        Effectively, this calculates the distance squared as follows:
        dxy2 = (this.x - other.x)2 + (this.y - other.y)2

        This method is usually preferred over distanceXY(FramePoint3DReadOnly) when calculation speed matters and knowledge of the actual distance does not, i.e. when comparing distances between several pairs of frame points.

        Parameters:
        other - the other frame point used to measure the square of the distance.
        Returns:
        the square of the distance between the two frame points in the XY-plane.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if other is not expressed in the same frame as this.

      • distanceXY

        default double distanceXY​(FramePoint2DReadOnly framePoint2DReadOnly)
        Calculates and returns the distance between this frame point and framePoint2DReadOnly in the XY-plane.

        Effectively, this calculates the distance as follows:
        dxy = √((this.x - framePoint2DReadOnly.x)2 + (this.y - framePoint2DReadOnly.y)2)

        Parameters:
        framePoint2DReadOnly - the other frame point used to measure the distance.
        Returns:
        the distance between the two frame points in the XY-plane.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if framePoint2DReadOnly is not expressed in the same frame as this.

      • distanceXYSquared

        default double distanceXYSquared​(FramePoint2DReadOnly framePoint2DReadOnly)
        Calculates and returns the square of the distance between this frame point and framePoint2DReadOnly in the XY-plane.

        Effectively, this calculates the distance squared as follows:
        dxy2 = (this.x - framePoint2DReadOnly.x)2 + (this.y - framePoint2DReadOnly.y)2

        This method is usually preferred over distanceXY(FramePoint2DReadOnly) when calculation speed matters and knowledge of the actual distance does not, i.e. when comparing distances between several pairs of points.

        Parameters:
        framePoint2DReadOnly - the other frame point used to measure the square of the distance.
        Returns:
        the square of the distance between the two frame points in the XY-plane.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if framePoint2DReadOnly is not expressed in the same frame as this.

      • geometricallyEquals

        default boolean geometricallyEquals​(FramePoint3DReadOnly other,
                                    double epsilon)
        Compares this to other to determine if the two frame points are geometrically similar, i.e. the distance between them is less than or equal to epsilon.
        Parameters:
        other - the frame point to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the two frame points represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if other is not expressed in the same reference frame as this.
